text: I've always felt toward the slightest scene, even if all I had to do in a scene was just to come in and say, 'Hi,' that the people ought to get their money's worth and that this is an obligation of mine, to give them the best you can get from me.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: When the federal government spends more each year than it collects in tax revenues, it has three choices: It can raise taxes, print money, or borrow money. While these actions may benefit politicians, all three options are bad for average Americans.
author: Ron Paul

text: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Run for your life from any man who tells you that money is evil. That sentence is the leper's bell of an approaching looter.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
author: Satchel Paige
